<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q53')" data-correct-answer="B">
<strong style="display: block;">The market has an expected return of 8%, the risk-free rate is 4%. A stock with β = 1.5 has an expected return of 12%. What is its alpha?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q53" value="A"> A. -2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q53" value="B"> B. 0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q53" value="C"> C. +1%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q53" value="D"> D. +2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q53" value="E"> E. +3%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q53" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct:  CAPM return = 4% + 1.5 × (8% − 4%) = 10%. Alpha = 12% − 10% = +2%. Correction: should be D.
</div>
